excerpt: Originally an Arabian fort, this grand palace is used by the Royal Family for various events.
detail_description: The Royal Palace of La Almudaina, a stunning blend of history and architecture, is located in Palma, right next to the iconic cathedral. Originally an Arabian fort, it was transformed into a royal residence by King Jaume after the Christian conquest in 1229. This magnificent palace serves as one of the official residences for the Spanish royal family and showcases various areas open to visitors.
name: Royal Palace of La Almudaina
address: Carrer del Palau Reial, s/n, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Palma is a resort city and capital of the Spanish island of Mallorca (Majorca), in the western Mediterranean. The massive Santa María cathedral, a Gothic landmark begun in the 13th century, overlooks the Bay of Palma. The adjacent Almudaina is a Moorish-style Arab fortress converted to a royal residence. West of the city, hilltop Bellver Castle is a medieval fortress with a distinctive circular shape.
detail_description: Palma, the capital of Mallorca in the western Mediterranean, is a resort city known for its rich history and stunning landmarks. The Gothic Santa María cathedral and the Moorish-style Almudaina fortress are just a few examples of its architectural wonders. This vibrant city is considered one of the most beautiful in the Mediterranean, offering a mix of history, culture, and culinary delights.
name: Palma
address: Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Museum in 16th- & 21st-century buildings housing more than 800 works, some with links to the island.
detail_description: Es Baluard Museu d'Art Contemporani de Palma is a must-visit museum in Palma, housed in 16th- and 21st-century buildings. It features over 800 works with connections to the island, showcasing contemporary art pieces from artists like Cezanne, Gauguin, Picasso, Miro, Magritte, Polke, Barcelo and Schnabel.
name: Es Baluard Museu d'Art Contemporani de Palma
address: Plaça de la Porta de Santa Catalina, 10, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: 1300s circular castle set on a wooded hilltop overlooking Palma, home to the city's history museum.
detail_description: Castell de Bellver, a 14th-century circular castle commissioned by James II of Aragon, sits atop a wooded hill overlooking Palma. Initially built as a royal residence, it later served as a military prison. Today, the castle houses the City History Museum showcasing Mallorca's history through various artifacts and exhibits. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Palma and its bay from the top of the castle while surrounded by fragrant pine woods.
name: Castell de Bellver
address: Carrer Camilo José Cela, s/n, Ponent, 07014 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: The former fishing barrio of Santa Catalina is a hip enclave centered on a centuries-old market piled with local produce. Leafy streets lined by gaily painted cottages and art nouveau mansions are packed with design boutiques and vintage stores. Martini lounges and music cafes sit alongside dive bars popular with a bohemian crowd, while trendy restaurants serving global cuisines occupy squares and backstreet alleys.
detail_description: Santa Catalina, a former fishing neighborhood, has transformed into a trendy area with a vibrant market offering local produce. The streets are adorned with colorful cottages and art nouveau mansions, hosting design boutiques and vintage stores. This hip enclave features martini lounges, music cafes, and dive bars attracting a bohemian crowd. Additionally, trendy restaurants serving global cuisines can be found in squares and backstreet alleys.
name: Santa Catalina
address: Ponent District, Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Mercat de Santa Catalina is a must-visit undercover food market in the trendy Santa Catalina neighborhood. It's recommended to explore it after sunset, as the area comes alive with its thriving nightlife, featuring trendy bars, clubs, and contemporary restaurants. The market offers a variety of local delicacies such as sobrassada sausage, olive oil, meats, cheeses, wines, and liqueurs. You can also find stalls selling oils, chutneys, honey, and other packaged goods.
name: Mercat de Santa Catalina
address: Plaça de la Navegació, s/n, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Galeria Plaza Mayor is an elegant square with beautiful colonnades, stretching from Calle San Miguel to Plaza Cort. The square features a stunning 600-year-old olive tree in front of the town hall, making it a popular spot for photo opportunities. During peak seasons, the narrow streets can get crowded, but it's still a charming place to explore and take in the local atmosphere.
name: Galeria plaza Mayor
address: Pl. Major, 3, Centre, 07002 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Vendors sell produce, cheese, seafood, pastries & prepared foods in a light-filled historic hall.
detail_description: Mercat de l’Olivar is Palma's largest covered market, conveniently located near the Placa d'Espanya and the main transport hub. The historic hall is filled with vendors selling a variety of goods, from produce and cheese to seafood and pastries. It has been open since the 1950s and offers an array of Balearic cheeses, fresh fruits and vegetables, Spanish olives, island salts, as well as takeaway Mallorcan meals.
name: Mercat de l’Olivar
address: Plaça de l'Olivar, s/n, Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Vast shark tank & ocean habitats in aquarium with jungle micro-climate roof garden & guided tours.
detail_description: Palma Aquarium, located near the airport and opened in 2007, boasts the largest live coral collection in Europe. The aquarium features over 700 types of creatures, including impressive sand tiger sharks in the 'Big Blue' tank with three million liters of water. With more than 55 aquariums and 8000 fish from around the world, it offers an ideal family day out.
name: Palma Aquarium
address: Carrer de Manuela de los Herreros, 21, Platja de Palma, 07610 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: A beach resort by day, Playa de Palma transforms into a drinking and clubbing destination at night. Fringed by palm trees and a seafront promenade, it attracts families for swimming and water sports in the Bay of Palma, and water slides at Aqualand El Arenal. Chic hotels and gourmet restaurants are springing up among the souvenir shops, nightclubs, and themed bars popular with vacationers.
detail_description: Playa de Palma is a versatile destination that offers both relaxation and vibrant nightlife. During the day, families can enjoy swimming, water sports, and Aqualand El Arenal's water slides in the Bay of Palma. The seafront promenade is lined with palm trees and features chic hotels, gourmet restaurants, souvenir shops, nightclubs, and themed bars. At night, the area transforms into a lively party scene.
name: Platja de Palma
address: Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Long, sandy strip on the Bay of Palma, popular for swimming & walking in view of Mallorca Cathedral.
detail_description: Platja de Can Pere Antoni is a long sandy beach located on the Bay of Palma, offering stunning views of Mallorca Cathedral. Despite its proximity to Palma, it remains relatively quiet and is easily accessible by public transport or bicycle. The beach is popular among locals and visitors alike for swimming, walking along the palm-tree-lined promenade, and soaking up the sun on its fine white sand.
name: Platja de Can Pere Antoni
address: Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Part of Palma's Old Town area, La Seu brims with centuries-old landmarks, notably the sandstone Cathedral of Santa Maria of Palma (or La Seu Cathedral), one of Europe's tallest Gothic buildings. Close by, the 1300s Royal Palace of La Almudaina serves as the official residence of Spain's royal family when they visit Mallorca. Museu Diocesà displays Christian art and artifacts in the 13th-century Episcopal Palace.
detail_description: La Seu, located in Palma's Old Town, is a historic area filled with centuries-old landmarks. The standout attraction is the Cathedral of Santa Maria of Palma, also known as La Seu Cathedral, which is one of Europe's tallest Gothic buildings. Nearby, the Royal Palace of La Almudaina dates back to the 1300s and serves as the official residence for Spain's royal family during their visits to Mallorca.
name: La Seu
address: Centre, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: The Catedral de Mallorca looms over this tranquil, tree-lined hangout with benches & a lagoon.
detail_description: Parc de la Mar is a tranquil and beautiful hangout in Palma, featuring tree-lined paths, benches, and a lagoon. It's known for its proximity to the grand Gothic cathedral of Mallorca, offering visitors the chance to admire its lofty ceilings and intricate Gaudi work. The park also houses a charming playground with three climbing frames, including one resembling a castle tower.
name: Parc de la Mar
address: 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Carrer de Sant Agustí, 7 is nestled in one of Palma's most exclusive neighborhoods, where the charm of the Old Town and Calatrava districts beckons with their rich history and stunning architecture. This area is a haven for those who appreciate an international community and easy access to Palma’s vibrant hotspots. Picture yourself strolling through picturesque cobbled streets that lead you to delightful shops, cozy cafes, and exquisite restaurants.
name: Carrer de Sant Agustí, 7
address: Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Church & convent founded in 1281, with an intricate gothic cloister & a baroque facade.
detail_description: In the heart of Palma, the Basílica de Sant Francesc is a remarkable example of medieval architecture. Founded in 1281, this Franciscan church boasts an intricate Gothic cloister and a majestic sandstone facade adorned with elegant detailing. Inside, visitors are greeted by a tranquil space illuminated by a rose window and supported by towering pillars. The church also holds historical significance as it was where Fra Junipero Serra, founder of San Francisco, California, was educated.
name: Basílica de Sant Francesc
address: Plaça de Sant Francesc, 7, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Iconic street in the town's historic center lined with modernist buildings, statues & upscale shops.
detail_description: Passeig del Born is a renowned street in the heart of the historic center, featuring modernist buildings, statues, and upscale shops. It's conveniently close to La Almudaina palace and offers a delightful ambiance with its tree-lined walkway. The area is a shopping haven, hosting an array of designer stores like Zara, Stradivarius, Massimo Dutti, Max Mara, and Louis Vuitton.
name: Pg. del Born
address: Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Plaça de Cort is a charming square in the historic district, featuring a 600-year-old olive tree and a medieval town hall. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely break at Cafe Cappuccino for coffee or fresh orange juice before exploring the maze of Moorish-feeling streets leading towards El Borne.
name: Plaça de Cort
address: Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: A tranquil garden surrounds the remains of these Arab baths from the time of Moorish rule.
detail_description: Banys Àrabs, also known as Arab Baths, is a historic site in Palma that offers a glimpse into the Islamic architecture of Majorca. Dating back to the 11th century, these baths are one of the few remaining examples of Moorish influence on the island. The construction of Banys Àrabs was a testament to Mallorca's cultural and commercial significance during that time.
name: Banys Àrabs
address: Carrer de Can Serra, 7, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Shopping area, restaurants & estate agents in a leisure marina with 650 mooring spaces.
detail_description: Puerto Portals is a charming leisure marina with 650 mooring spaces, offering a unique Mediterranean atmosphere. It's an ideal location for property buyers seeking proximity to the sea and Palma, with options for different types of buyers and families due to its tranquil vibe and access to international schools. The area is surrounded by first-class restaurants, bars, and beaches like Costa d'en Blanes and Playa Portals Nous. Visitors can also enjoy the nearby Royal Golf Course in Bendinat.
name: Puerto Portals
address: Torre de Capitanía, 07181 Portals Nous-Calvià, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Es Portixol is a charming coastal area located to the east, featuring a marina with inviting bars and cafes that offer picturesque terraces. Visitors can enjoy delectable meals at places like Sa Roqueta, known for its rich rice dishes such as fideua mulata and whole fish. The area boasts a long beach walkway perfect for leisurely strolls, lined with various bars, restaurants, and ice cream shops without an overload of touristy stores.
name: Es Portixol
address: Platja de Palma, Spain

name: Periplo Portixol
address: Carrer del Vicari Joaquim Fuster, 67, Playa de Palma, 07006 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Ornate Gothic edifice overlooking the sea, with a vast rose window & wrought-iron canopy by Gaudí.
detail_description: The Catedral-Basílica de Santa María de Mallorca, also known as La Seu, is a stunning Gothic edifice that overlooks the Mediterranean Sea. This architectural marvel was constructed over several centuries and showcases a blend of Moorish, Gothic, and Modernist influences. The cathedral features one of the largest rose windows in the world, known as the Gothic eye, which fills its interior with an ethereal light during morning hours.
name: Catedral-Basílica de Santa María de Mallorca
address: Plaça de la Seu, s/n, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Museum in a grand 17th-century building showcasing works from 20th-century Spanish artists.
detail_description: Fundació Joan March is a must-visit for enthusiasts of Spanish art and culture. Housed in a stunning 17th-century mansion, the foundation is dedicated to promoting arts and humanities through various activities. The museum showcases an impressive collection of Spanish avant-garde art from the early 20th century, featuring works by renowned artists like Joan Miró, Salvador Dalí, and Pablo Picasso.
name: Fundación Juan March Palma
address: Carrer de Sant Miquel, 11, Distrito Centro, 07002 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Moorish-style gardens, originally part of a royal palace, with ornate fountains & shady paths.
detail_description: S'Hort del Rei, also known as the Kings Gardens, is a charming Moorish-style garden located next to the Royal Palace of the Almudaina in Spain. Originally exclusive to the royal family, it was opened to the public after being remodeled in traditional Andalusian style in the 1960s. The gardens feature ornate fountains, shady paths, an archway dating back to Muslim times over a pond, and three sculptures by renowned artists.
name: L'Hort del Rei
address: Av. d'Antoni Maura, 18, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Tasting menus of adventurous Mediterranean-inspired cuisine, plus wine pairing, in a sleek space.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Palma's old town at Hotel Convent de la Missio, Marc Fosh Restaurant offers an affordable Michelin-starred dining experience. The restaurant, opened by award-winning British chef Marc Fosh, serves modern Mediterranean cuisine with a focus on seasonal ingredients. Guests can indulge in tasting menus and wine pairings in the sleek and contemporary setting.
name: Marc Fosh Restaurant
address: Carrer de la Missió, 7, Distrito Centro, 07003 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Palace & courtyard now serving as a cultural-events center with a series of rotating exhibitions.
detail_description: Casal Solleric, an 18th-century Baroque-style palace located in the heart of Palma, has been restored and transformed into a cultural events center. It hosts rotating exhibitions featuring contemporary art and photography, including international artists' monographic displays and projects by local artists. The palace is also home to the annual Ciudad de Palma photography and painting prize.
name: Casal Solleric
address: Pg. del Born, 27, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Tapas, filled baguettes & cocktails at a wood-beamed tavern with art deco touches & a terrace.
detail_description: Café la Lonja is a charming wood-beamed tavern with art deco touches and a terrace, offering tapas, filled baguettes, and cocktails. It is located in the heart of a neighborhood that features narrow streets lined with restaurants, cafes, and bars. Nearby attractions include the historic La Lonja building, which was once a fish market in the 15th century.
name: Café la Lonja
address: Carrer de la Llotja, 2, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the charming Old Town of Palma de Mallorca, Old Town Tattoos is a must-visit for anyone looking to enhance their body art collection. This hygienic and beautifully designed studio boasts talented artists like Christian Otto and Stephen, who are not only skilled but also incredibly personable. Visitors rave about their experiences, whether it's getting a new tattoo or touching up an existing one. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming, making it easy to strike up conversations while you get inked.
name: OLD TOWN TATTOOS
address: Carrer de Can Martí Feliu, 4, Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Family-oriented Cala Major is a seaside resort with a broad stretch of sand overlooking the Bay of Palma. The beach is shaded by palm trees, dotted with parasols, and backed by laid-back “chiringuito” beach bars serving sangria and tapas. The area’s resurgence has seen a few boutique hotels and restaurants open among the cafes offering all-day breakfast and British-style pubs.
detail_description: Cala Major is a family-friendly seaside resort with a wide sandy beach that offers views of the Bay of Palma. The area has seen a revival with the opening of boutique hotels, restaurants, and beach bars serving sangria and tapas. In addition to its beautiful beaches, Cala Major is also home to the Joan Miro museum, located in the famous painter's former residence. Families visiting the area can enjoy water parks and indoor activities like the Palma Aquarium.
name: Cala Major
address: Ponent District, Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: La Lonja Marina Charter is located in Palma, the capital of Mallorca. The city offers a variety of attractions such as Paseo del Borne, Avenida Jaime III for shopping, the historic quarter, La Lonja district, Santa Catalina neighborhood, Promenade, Portixol fishing district and Playa de Palma. Visitors can also explore the exclusive Son Vida golf course and marvel at the stunning Palma Cathedral known as La Seu.
name: La Lonja Marina Charter
address: Muelle de la lonja, s/n, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Genteel, rustic eatery with a terrace plating creative local fare & sweets, plus a robust wine list.
detail_description: Aromata is a charming rustic restaurant located in Palma, Mallorca. The eatery offers a creative local menu and an extensive wine selection. Housed in an atmospheric historic building with ancient stone arches and a light-filled atrium, the restaurant provides a relaxing ambience with contemporary wood furniture and original stone floors.
name: Aromata
address: Carrer de Ramon y Cajal, 12, 07011 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Quaint, narrow-gauge wooden train, dating to 1912, running along a scenic path from Sóller to Palma.
detail_description: Train Sóller Station, also known as Ferrocarril de Soller, is a historic narrow-gauge railway that has been operating since 1912. The charming wooden train takes passengers on a scenic 27km journey from Palma de Mallorca to the picturesque town of Sóller, nestled in a lush valley between mountains and the sea.
name: Train Sóller Station (Palma de Mallorca)
address: Carrer d'Eusebi Estada, 1, Nord, 07004 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

name: Palma Markets
address: Pg. del Born, 20, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Palma de Mallorca, Sa Llotja del Peix stands as a stunning example of Gothic architecture and historical significance. Constructed in 1426, this remarkable building was originally designed as a bustling trading hub for merchants. Today, it not only showcases its architectural beauty with three equally tall naves supported by six elegant helical columns but also serves as a cultural venue housing the Fine Arts Museum and hosting various temporary exhibitions.
name: Sa Llotja del Peix
address: Carrer Contramoll Mollet, 3, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Esglesia de Santa Eulalia, originally known as the Church of the Holy Cross, is a historic Gothic church in Palma. Construction on this original parish church began in 1335. The main entrance can be found at Carrer de Santa Creu 7.
name: Esglesia de Santa Eulalia
address: Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

name: Sailing Palma, Private Sailing boat trips, day charter
address: muelle de, Carrer de Sant Pere, 1, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

name: Galeria K
address: Carrer de Tous i Maroto, 4, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Tucked in a cove, this small, sandy beach offers shallow turquoise water & scenic sunset views.
detail_description: Caló del Moro is a hidden gem nestled in a picturesque cove on the southeast coast of Mallorca, near Sant Antoni de Portmany. This enchanting beach boasts soft golden sands and stunningly clear turquoise waters that create an inviting atmosphere for sunbathers and swimmers alike. The rugged coastline surrounding Caló del Moro adds to its charm, making it feel like a slice of paradise. Accessible only by foot through lush pine trees, this secluded spot offers breathtaking sunset views that are perfect for capturing unforgettable moments.
name: Caló del Moro
address: 07650 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Workshops where Miró painted & sculpted from 1950s to 1980s, with permanent & temporary exhibitions.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Palma de Mallorca, the Fundació Miró Mallorca is a treasure trove dedicated to the illustrious Spanish artist Joan Miró. This captivating foundation showcases an extensive collection of his paintings, sculptures, and ceramics within its unique Moneo Building. Visitors can immerse themselves in Miró's creative journey by exploring his workshops—the Sert Studio and Son Boter—where he passionately painted and sculpted from the 1950s to the 1980s.
name: Fundació Miró Mallorca
address: C/ de Saridakis, 29, Ponent, 07015 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Bustling sandy beach stretching 656 feet with some rattan umbrellas in front of a hotel complex.
detail_description: Cala Major is a bustling sandy beach that stretches 656 feet and features rattan umbrellas in front of a hotel complex. It's conveniently located close to Palma, making it less crowded than expected, offering visitors a perfect place to relax and swim. The surrounding area is known for being one of the cheapest places to live in Spain, making it an attractive option for those considering relocating to Mallorca. Cala Major also boasts restaurants, bars, and resort hotels nearby.
name: Cala Major
address: Avinguda de Joan Miró, 279, 07015 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: 15th-century guild building with dramatic Gothic architecture, hosting occasional art exhibitions.
detail_description: Llotja de Palma, also known as Sa Llotja, is a stunning 15th-century guild building in Palma. This Gothic architectural masterpiece was originally used as the city's exchange during Mallorca's maritime trading heyday. Constructed with the finest stone from Santanyi, it has served various purposes over the centuries, including as a store for goods and guns during the War of Independence and later as a gallery for fine art.
name: Llotja de Palma
address: Plaça de la Llotja, 5, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Attraction & event space in a replica city featuring recreated Spanish buildings & landmarks.
detail_description: Poble Espanyol de Mallorca is a wonderful replica of Spanish buildings and landmarks, including Court of the Myrtles from Granada's Alhambra, Christ of the Lanterns from Cordoba, and others. This open-air museum is located just outside of Palma de Mallorca and is easily accessible on foot or by car. The models are 1:2 scale so you can see all the most important features in just an hour or so!
name: Poble Espanyol de Mallorca
address: Carrer del Poble Espanyol, 55, Ponent, 07014 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Caves entered through a restaurant & open for guided tours of illuminated limestone formations.
detail_description: Coves de Gènova, located in the Genova district near Palma de Mallorca, is a popular destination for nature enthusiasts seeking tranquility. The caves feature illuminated limestone formations and are easily accessible by bus. Visitors can explore underground galleries with pools, tunnels, and columns formed naturally by water action. Guided tours provide interesting stories about the caves, followed by refreshments at the on-site restaurant.
name: Coves de Gènova
address: Carrer del Barranc, 45, Ponent, 07015 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: A diverse collection of art, sculpture & antique books is showcased in a stately former residence.
detail_description: The Fundación Bartolomé March is a historic mansion turned modern art museum located in Palma de Mallorca. The stately former residence showcases a diverse collection of art, sculpture, and antique books. The palatial house was once owned by the phenomenally wealthy March family and now houses sculptures by 20th-century greats such as Henry Moore, Auguste Rodin, Barbara Hepworth, and Eduardo Chillida.
name: Fundación Bartolomé March
address: Carrer del Palau Reial, 18, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Museu Històric Militar de Sant Carles is situated near the industrial zone, close to Castell de Sant Carles and the historic Porto Pi lighthouse. The museum offers a collection of war memorabilia, including Spanish war history exhibits and a diverse array of guns and knives from around the world. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the city and harbor from this location.
name: Museu Històric Militar de Sant Carles
address: Carretera Dic de l'Oest, s/n, Ponent, 07015 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Edifici Casasayas and Pension Menorquina are two stunning buildings in Palma, designed simultaneously in 1908 and 1909. They stand facing each other at Placa Mercat, separated by Calle de Santacilia. The symmetrical structures boast Modernist-Art Nouveau style with matching facades and interior layouts. Despite plans for a connecting bridge being denied, the buildings exhibit parabolic windows and undulating forms reminiscent of Gaudi's influence.
name: Edifici Casasayas
address: Costa de Can Santacília, 8, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Plaça de les Tortugues, a popular tourist spot, is a square frequented by enthusiastic football supporters celebrating their team's victories. Though there is no evidence to support it, the square is believed to have been entirely constructed using turtles. This unique and picturesque location offers visitors a pleasant ambiance to unwind and savor their drinks. The place holds an extraordinary charm that captivates all who visit, making it an unforgettable experience for tourists seeking leisure and relaxation.
name: Plaça del Rei Joan Carles I (plaça de les Tortugues)
address: Pg. del Born, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: The Basílica de Sant Miquel de Palma is a stunning church located in the heart of Palma. It is currently undergoing some restoration work, allowing visitors to witness the meticulous process of applying gold leaf. Inside, the grand altar and statues, including one of Archangel Michael, are truly magnificent. The intricate architecture and colorful designs make for a breathtaking experience.
name: Basílica de Sant Miquel de Palma
address: Carrer de Sant Miquel, 21, Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Concerts by big-name bands & occasional bullfights in a 1929 bullring with capacity for 10,000.
name: Plaça de Toros (Coliseo Balear)
address: Av. Gaspar de Bennazar, 32, Nord, 07004 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: The Arc de sa Drassana, located near the Palau de l'Almudaina, stands as a grand reminder of the city's Arab past. This picturesque courtyard features a lovely pond with a fantastic arch leading across it, creating a serene and tranquil atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy this beautiful spot for free and take in its beauty while sitting by the water or strolling around.
name: Arc de sa Drassana
address: Passeig Dalt Murada, 1B, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain
